title.narrative: 101 DO EFFECTIVE SUPPORT PROVIDED

description.narrative: 101 DO Effective Support provided to results-based management, resource mobilization, operational efficiency and effectiveness within EMOPS and for the overall strategic guidance of UNICEF's humanitarian action., which contributes to Saving Lives And Protecting Rights In Humanitarian Situations, Technical Excellence In Humanitarian Action, United Nations Coherence And Cluster Coordination. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Timely, effective and reliable support is provided to country and regional offices to save lives and protect rights in humanitarian situations and to strengthen resilience

related-activity.ref: 456F/F0/09/100 TIMELY, EFFECTIVE AND RELIABLE SUPPORT I

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 101 DO Effective Support provided to results-based management, resource mobilization, operational efficiency and effectivenesswithin EMOPS and for the overall strategic guidance of UNICEF's humanitarian action.

description.narrative: EMOPS engaged with the UN system through active involvement in the Emergency Directors Group and participation in joint missions. Dialogue with key donors was maintained through regular meetings with DFID; the Swiss; ECHO; and governments of Denmark, Japan, Norway, Sweden and USA. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2018

title.narrative: Staff wellbeing is prioritised are staff are supported in their personal development efforts and staff
A predictable workplanning cycle is in place and reviews undertaken in a timely manner and results are effectively coordinated per major result area,
Coordination and efficiency within the division is supported and open information sharing exists
Staffing and resources are in place to implement OMP

baseline.value: 6 technical teams (HFSS, HPS, PDRR, PRS. IAHP and GCCU) including 50 Staff, Director's office representation including 14 staff. OPSCEN and security comprising 16 staff are in place,

title.narrative: Submission of corporate reporting on the divison and UNICEF's humanitarian action is timely and strategic

baseline.value: Annual report for previous year is submitted by deadline, EDAR submission is submitted by deadline, Global Thematic Humanitarian Report is submitted by deadline

title.narrative: Financial management and monitoring of EMOPs resources undertaken with budget holders,

baseline.value: Budget Financial Implementation Report are prepared monthly and reviewed against staffing expenditure

title.narrative: Influence UNICEF's corporate agenda and contribute to organisational efforts to enhance organisational effectiveness and efficiency, and ensure that they are informed by efforts to strengthen humanitarian action.

baseline.value: E&E9 and Strengthening Humanitarian Action initiative taking place in parallel, First draft of consultants report on use of Surge Capacity has been submitted as part of E&E10,

title.narrative: Timely recommendations are submitted to Executive Management for the declaration of emergencies at the appropriate level emergency and relevant resources mobilised in accordance with the CEAP.

baseline.value: EMOPS Director GEC in Philippines. L3 emergencies in Philippines, CAR and Syria and South Sudan as L2. Memos submitted in line with the CEAP

title.narrative: Regular EMOPS meetings support inter-section dialogue and cooperation,

baseline.value: EMOPS regular meetings include weekly Director meetings, weekly Section Chief Meetings, monthly All Staff meetings and quarterly general service staff meetings and quarterly meetings with staff representatives,

title.narrative: Effective Support provided to results-based management, resource mobilization, operational efficiency and effectiveness within EMOPS and for the overall strategic guidance of UNICEF's humanitarian action

baseline.value: HAC developed, shared with key partners and launched annually and updated throughout year.

title.narrative: Agreed strategic frameworks and workplans are in place for: capacity development, effective monitoring and reporting of results, effective relations with donors and internal business areas.

baseline.value: Manage global projects in support of institutional capacity building from DFID, Swiss, Denmark and ECHO, Provide support to analysis and reporting on voluntary core funding from DFID, Manage global Humantarian Thematic Funding on behalf of the organisation

title.narrative: REA Meeting organized

actual.value: 2017:Competing priorities meant that no REA meeting could be organized in 2016.

title.narrative: UNICEF provides leadership and direction in working with partners to improve the quality and efficiency of system-wide humanitarian response.

baseline.value: UNICEF Deputy Director contributes 50 percent of his time to an inter-agency group that supports the implementation of the transformative agenda in line with the system-wide work plan

title.narrative: UNICEF Executive Management are regularly updated on humanitarian issues as they relate to UNICEF
